description: Construction of a four-storey building for eight residential self-contained units (8 x 2 bed) (following demolition of existing buildings on site) including associated car parking, cycle parking, refuse, access and amenity space.
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990
| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following Drawings received by Council:
- C0216-5 - Existing Floor Plans
- C0216-E - Existing Elevations
- TS/P/20170131/01 - Existing Site Plan
- TS/P/20170131/02 - Block & Ground Floor Plan
- TS/P/20170131/03 - Proposed First, Second, Third Floor Plans
- TS/P/20170131/04 - Proposed South & East Elevations
- TS/P/20170131/05 - Proposed North & West Elevations
- TS/P/20170131/06 - Proposed Roof Plan, Location Plan & Schedule of Materials

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, in the interest of proper planning. | No occupation of the dwellings hereby approved shall take place until full details of boundary treatments and hard/soft landscaping works have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and these works shall be completed as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development.

Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area, to ensure appropriately landscaped amenity space in accordance with Policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), Policies 7.4, 7.6, and 7.8 of the London Plan (2016), and Policies 7.4, 7C, and 7D of the Ealing DPD (2013). | Sheltered and secure parking for at least 16 cycles shall be made available prior to the first occupation of any part of the development, and retained in perpetuity.

Reason: To ensure that the approved provision cycle parking is available in the interest of the highways management and the aims of promoting sustainable transport, in accordance with policy 6.9 of the London Plan (2016 as amended), Ealing's Sustainable Transport for New Development SPD, and section 4 of the National Planning Policy Framework. | The refuse storage facilities shown on the approved plans shall be fully implemented and made available for use prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved, and shall be permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure suitable refuse storage and collection facilities are provided prior to occupation in the interests of pedestrian and highway safety, and to protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties, in accordance with Policies 5.16 and 5.17 of the London Plan. | (a) Prior to commencement of the development, a desk-top study on the history of the site and a soil and water contamination survey and risk assessment shall be carried out in accordance with the guidelines set out in the Department of the Environment CLR report and in the CIRIA reports on remedial treatment for contaminated land volumes 1-12, and any subsequent updates of the reports. Details of the desktop study, soil and water contamination surveys and risk assessment shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval in writing prior to the commencement of the development.

(b) In the event of the findings of contamination to soil or water as a result of the surveys carried out under condition (a) above, a programme of remedial works shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval in writing prior to the commencement of the development.

(c) The approved remedial measures and monitoring and certification of the works shall be carried out by a company consultant or organisation quality-assured under ISO 9001 and the approved remedial works shall be completed prior to first occupation of the development, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority beforehand or unless carried out in accordance with a programme which has been agreed in advance in writing by the Local Planning Authority. No property shall be occupied until a certificate has been received by the Local Planning Authority verifying that remedial works on that part of the site have been completed. A full validation report and final completion certificate shall be provided by the company consultant or organisation that carried out the remedial works on completion of this scheme.

Reason: In the interests of public and environment protection. | Building envelope insulation for the approved residential building, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided, shall be installed to achieve the internal noise targets adopted by the Local Planning Authority:
i) Bedrooms (23.00-07.00 hrs) 30 dB LAeq and 45 dB Lmax (fast).
ii) Living rooms (07.00-23.00 hrs) 35 dB LAeq.
iii) Kichens, bathrooms, WC and utility rooms (07.00-23.00 hrs) 45 dB LAeq.
The sound insulation measures shall be installed and fully completed prior to the first use and / or first occupation of the flats and maintained thereafter.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 7.15 of the London Plan (2016); policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012); policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and interim SPG10: Noise and Vibration. | A noise assessment, by an approved acoustic consultant shall be carried out in accordance with the criteria specified in the Supplementary Planning Guide for Noise and Vibration (SPG10). The assessment along with a scheme of proposed noise mitigation measures, with windows closed and other means of ventilation provided, shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority. Such details as approved shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of any residential unit and thereafter permanently retained.

Reason: To protect the amenity of occupants who will be living in proximity to noise sources (e.g. The Broadway and A4020), in accordance with policy 7A of Ealing Council's Development Management DPD (adopted 2013) and policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2016). | No development (including initial site clearance) shall commence until a Demolition and Construction Management Plan has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The management plan must refer to the following matters:
a) Removal of any earth from the site.
b) Construction methods.
c) Site management and access.
d) Signage for construction traffic, pedestrians and other users of the site;
e) Prevention of mud and debris being deposited on The Broadway and A4020;
f) Vehicle and machinery specification.
g) Turning manoeuvres and routeing of vehicles.
h) Estimated number and frequency of vehicle deliveries.
i) Parking of construction vehicles.
j) Compliance with noise limits and vibration mitigation measures.
k) Procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents.
l) Mitigation of air pollution and dust emissions during site clearance, demolition, excavation and construction works.
m) Waste management, hazardous material storage and removal.

Reason: To protect the amenity of neighbouring properties and mitigate impacts to highway traffic in accordance with policy 7A and policy 7B of Ealing's Development Management DPD (adopted 2013), policy 7.14 and policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (adopted 2012) and National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
